author: TooMuchLEGO
title: You know, it's not perfect, but it's fun. Very fun.
review:
LEGO video games have recently been the exact same- except the theme and characters. But though the gameplay hasn't changed much at all in this game, that's not to say it's not fun- I've had a blast with it. It doesn't hold the record for most playtime on my 3DS or anything, and it's not like you gotta go out and buy a 3DS so you can play it, but it's fun nontheless. I love the space battles and the graphics are gorgeous, and the 3D ain't too shabby either. And thankfully for the LEGO video game series, the game play has held up considerably well. I also enjoy the inclusion of mini-games, but they often keep me from playing the actual game.

Pros

  • Gorgeous Graphics
  • Great 3D (the effect doesn't make your eyes melt in this game, and you can see that one object looks closer than another.)
  • Fun Game play that's held up well
  • the new space battles, which resemble the ones in Battlefront 2
  • Machine Guns! :D
  • Fun Mini-games

Cons

  • People who don't keep up with Star Wars- the Clone Wars will have no idea what's going on (I myself was confused at one point)
  • The long levels- I'd prefer if they were shorter, they're super lengthy in this game
  • Having to purchase some story characters (really? I gotta buy Yoda?)
  • Mini-games can be more fun than the game itself

Overall, the game is pretty fun. Yes, it could be better, and yeah, pressing "Y" repeatedly to smash a baddie can admittedly get boring at points, but in the end, it doesn't matter. LEGO Star Wars III: The Clone Wars is the LEGO formula polished to the nth degree. You'd miss out if you didn't buy it.
